Identification.LongTitle: National Parks of Canada Aircraft Access Regulations

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Canadian Heritagea, pursuant to subsection 7(1)b of the National Parks Act, hereby makes the annexed National Parks Aircraft Access Regulations.

Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: aircraft has the same meaning as in subsection 3(1) of the Aeronautics Act. (aéronef)

diversion means a forced or precautionary landing to address or avert an imminent or potential threat to the safety of a pilot, a passenger or a person on the ground if the pilot cannot return safely to the take-off point and if continuing to the planned destination is not feasible, including a landing because of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a medical emergency of the pilot or a passenger;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a mechanical or fuel problem that renders continued operation of the aircraft unsafe;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the minimum visual meteorological conditions for VFR flight, as set out in Part VI, Subpart 2, Division VI of the Canadian Aviation Regulations, not being met; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the destination airstrip becoming unusable while the flight is in progress. (déroutement)

Definition.Text: permit means an aircraft access permit issued pursuant to subsection 3(1). (permis)

Section.Text: These Regulations apply to parks and, subject to sections 40 and 41 of the Canada National Parks Act, to park reserves as if they were parks.
These Regulations do not apply in respect of non-motorized aircraft that are incapable of transporting persons.
These Regulations do not apply in respect of non-motorized paragliders or hang-gliders.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 5, it is prohibited for a person to conduct a take-off or landing of an aircraft in a park, other than in a park set out in column I of the schedule at a take-off and landing location set out in column II.

It is prohibited for a person to conduct a take-off or landing of an aircraft in a park set out in any of items 1 to 9, 11 or 12, column I, of the schedule unless that person is the holder of a permit.
It is prohibited for a person to conduct a take-off or landing of an aircraft in the park set out in item 13, column I, of the schedule, other than

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for non-commercial recreational purposes if the person is the holder of a permit; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: to land in the case of a diversion or other emergency situation.

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for a person to conduct a take-off or landing of an aircraft in the park set out in item 14, column I, of the schedule, other than to land in the case of a diversion or other emergency situation.
In the case of a landing referred to in paragraph (3)(b) or subsection (4), the person must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notify the superintendent as soon as feasible after landing of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the fact that they have landed at a take-off and landing location set out in item 13 or 14, column II, of the schedule, as the case may be, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the nature of the diversion or other emergency situation; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: obtain the superintendent’s authorization before take-off.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (4), the superintendent may issue an aircraft access permit to any person who applies.
The application referred to in subsection (1) shall be made in the form determined by the superintendent and shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the owner of the aircraft that the applicant proposes to use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of a person, other than the applicant, to be contacted in an emergency;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the make, model and registration number of the aircraft that the applicant proposes to use;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed date or dates or period of time for take-off or landing, or both; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the location or locations that the applicant proposes to use for take-off or landing, or both.

Subsection.Text: An operator of a commercial air service that applies for a permit shall submit with the application a copy of the licence issued to the operator pursuant to section 4.1 or subsection 10.1(2) of the National Parks of Canada Businesses Regulations that authorizes the operator to operate the service in the park in question.
The superintendent shall, before issuing a permit, take into account

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the natural and cultural resources of the park;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the safety, health and enjoyment of visitors or residents of the park; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the preservation, control and management of the park.

Subsection.Text: The superintendent shall set out in a permit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the permit holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of the owner of the aircraft to be used; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name, address and telephone number of a person, other than the permit holder, to be contacted in an emergency.

Subsection.Text: The superintendent shall set out in a permit terms and conditions that specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the make, model and registration number of the aircraft to be used;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date or dates or period of time authorized by the superintendent for take-off or landing, or both;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the location or locations authorized by the superintendent for take-off or landing, or both; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: any other matter that is necessary for the preservation, control and management of the park in which the landing or take-off is authorized.

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: suspend a permit, where the permit holder fails to comply with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: reinstate a suspended permit, where the failure that gave rise to the suspension has been remedied; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: refuse to issue a permit, for a period not exceeding one year, to a person convicted of a contravention of these Regulations or the Aeronautics Act.

Section.Text: The superintendent may authorize the use of a take-off and landing location in a park set out in any of items 1, 3 to 7 or 10, column I, of the schedule, other than a location set out in column II, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: there is no other reasonable means of access to that area of the park;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: such use will not result in any significant adverse effects to the ecological integrity or public safety of that area of the park; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: such use will not impair the enjoyment of that area of the park by other persons.

Section.Text: Notwithstanding anything in these Regulations, the superintendent may authorize the take-off and landing of an aircraft anywhere in a park for the purposes of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: natural or cultural resource management and protection directly related to the administration of the park;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any other management or control function directly related to the administration of the park;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: public safety; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: law enforcement.

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: Thomsen River where it empties into Castel Bay, at latitude 74°04′55″N, longitude 119°46′00″W

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: 1 km north of confluence of Muskox and Thomsen Rivers, latitude 73°49′05″N, longitude 119°51′58″W

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: Thomsen River 10 km south of Castel Bay, latitude 73°59′01″N, longitude 119°42′43″W

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: South boundary of the park along Thomsen River, latitude 73°00′46″N, longitude 119°37′52″W

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: Margaret Lake airstrip at latitude 68°49′30″N, longitude 140°37′30″W

row.entry: Kluane National Park Reserve of Canada

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: Quintino Sella Glacier at latitude 60°36′20″N, longitude 140°48′30″W

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: South Arm Kaskawulsh Glacier at latitude 60°30′30″N, longitude 138°53′00″W

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: Lowell Lake and Lowell Lake Bar at latitude 60°16′14″N, longitude 137°59′25″W

row.entry: Nahanni National Park Reserve of Canada

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: South Nahanni River at latitude 62°01′35″N, longitude 127°19′35″W

row.entry: Tuktut Nogait National Park of Canada
Wood Buffalo National Park of Canada
Garden Creek airstrip at latitude 58°42′30″N, longitude 113°53′30″W
